comment: The variable name flag lacks descriptiveness, making it hard to understand its purpose at a glance. Consider renaming it to capitalize_next for greater clarity, which more accurately reflects its role in determining when to capitalize the next character in the sequence.

The variable name flag lacks descriptiveness, making it hard to understand its purpose at a glance. Consider renaming it to uncapitalize_next for greater clarity, which more accurately reflects its role in determining when to uncapitalize the next character in the sequence.

The naming of the variable flag could be enhanced to better convey its purpose within the function. Consider renaming it to last_was_gap, which more accurately describes its role in identifying whether the last character was a delimiter or whitespace, thus improving code readability.

The variable name ws is not sufficiently descriptive, making its purpose unclear. It is recommended to rename it to whitespace to more clearly reflect that it indicates the presence or handling of whitespace in the string manipulation logic.
The code contains a redundant nested if-else structure that could be simplified. Consider revising this part of the code to enhance clarity and efficiency.
The code contains a redundant nested if-else structure that could be simplified. Consider revising this part of the code to enhance clarity and efficiency.

The method properly validates the upper parameter, ensuring it is not less than 0 and not less than lower. However, the documentation suggests that an upper value of -1 indicates no limit, which is not implemented or handled in the code.
